api_vip.description: The virtual IP used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this VIP is associated with.

ca_certificate.description: A CA certficate to be used when contacting the URL via https.

ignition_endpoint_token.description: A string which will be used as Authorization Bearer token to fetch the ignition from ignition_endpoint_url.

verify_cidr.description: Whether to verify if the API VIP belongs to one of the interfaces (DEPRECATED).

api_vip_connectivity_response.description:
The response from the day-2 agent's attempt to download the worker ignition file from the API machine config server of the target cluster.
Note - the name "API VIP connectivity" is old and misleading and is preserved for backwards compatibility.

download_error.description: The error that occurred while downloading the worker ignition file, ignored when is_success is true

ignition.description:
Ignition file fetched from the target cluster's API machine config server.
This ignition file may be incomplete as almost all files / systemd units are removed from it by the agent in order to save space.

is_success.description: Whether the agent was able to download the ignition or not

url.description: This parameter mirrors the url parameter of the corresponding api_vip_connectivity_request

additional_ntp_source.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

ams_subscription_id.description: Unique identifier of the AMS subscription in OCM.

api_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API.

api_vip_dns_name.description: The domain name used to reach the OpenShift cluster API.

api_vips.description: The virtual IPs used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

base_dns_domain.description: Base domain of the cluster. All DNS records must be sub-domains of this base and include the cluster name.

cluster_network_cidr.description: IP address block from which Pod IPs are allocated. This block must not overlap with existing physical networks. These IP addresses are used for the Pod network, and if you need to access the Pods from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_network_host_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length to assign to each individual node. For example, if clusterNetworkHostPrefix is set to 23, then each node is assigned a /23 subnet out of the given cidr (clusterNetworkCIDR), which allows for 510 (2^(32 - 23) - 2) pod IPs addresses. If you are required to provide access to nodes from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_networks.description: Cluster networks that are associated with this cluster.

connectivity_majority_groups.description: Json formatted string containing the majority groups for connectivity checks.

cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

created_at.description: The time that this cluster was created.

enabled_host_count.description: hosts associated to this cluster that are not in 'disabled' state.

feature_usage.description: JSON-formatted string containing the usage information by feature name

high_availability_mode.description:
Guaranteed availability of the installed cluster. 'Full' installs a Highly-Available cluster
over multiple master nodes whereas 'None' installs a full cluster over one node.

host_networks.description: List of host networks to be filled during query.

hosts.description: Hosts that are associated with this cluster.

http_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTP connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

https_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTPS connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

hyperthreading.description: Enable/disable hyperthreading on master nodes, worker nodes, or all nodes

ignored_cluster_validations.description: Json formatted string containing a list of cluster validations to be ignored. May also contain a list with a single string "all" to ignore all cluster validations. Some validations cannot be ignored.

ignored_host_validations.description: Json formatted string containing a list of host validations to be ignored. May also contain a list with a single string "all" to ignore all host validations. Some validations cannot be ignored.

imported.description:
Indicates whether this cluster is an imported day-2 cluster or a
regular cluster. Clusters are considered imported when they are
created via the ../clusters/import endpoint. Day-2 clusters converted
from day-1 clusters by kube-api controllers or the
../clusters/<cluster_id>/actions/allow-add-hosts endpoint are not
considered imported. Imported clusters usually lack a lot of
information and are filled with default values that don't necessarily
reflect the actual cluster they represent

ingress_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used for cluster ingress traffic.

ingress_vips.description: The virtual IPs used for cluster ingress traffic. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

install_completed_at.description: The time that this cluster completed installation.

install_config_overrides.description: JSON-formatted string containing the user overrides for the install-config.yaml file.

install_started_at.description: The time that this cluster started installation.

ip_collisions.description: Json formatted string containing ip collisions detected in the cluster.

kind.description:
Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Cluster' if this is a complete object,
'AddHostsCluster' for cluster that add hosts to existing OCP cluster,

machine_network_cidr.description: A CIDR that all hosts belonging to the cluster should have an interfaces with IP address that belongs to this CIDR. The api_vip belongs to this CIDR.

machine_networks.description: Machine networks that are associated with this cluster.

monitored_operators.description: Operators that are associated with this cluster.

no_proxy.description: A comma-separated list of destination domain names, domains, IP addresses, or other network CIDRs to exclude from proxying.

pull_secret_set.description: True if the pull secret has been added to the cluster.

ready_host_count.description: hosts associated to this cluster that are in 'known' state.

schedulable_masters_forced_true.description:
Indicates if schedule workloads on masters will be enabled regardless the value of 'schedulable_masters' property.
Set to 'true' when not enough hosts are associated with this cluster to disable the scheduling on masters.

service_network_cidr.description: The IP address pool to use for service IP addresses. You can enter only one IP address pool. If you need to access the services from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

service_networks.description: Service networks that are associated with this cluster.

ssh_public_key.description: SSH public key for debugging OpenShift nodes.

status_info.description: Additional information pertaining to the status of the OpenShift cluster.

status_updated_at.description: The last time that the cluster status was updated.

tags.description: A comma-separated list of tags that are associated to the cluster.

total_host_count.description: All hosts associated to this cluster.

updated_at.description: The last time that this cluster was updated.

user_managed_networking.description: Indicate if the networking is managed by the user.

validations_info.description: JSON-formatted string containing the validation results for each validation id grouped by category (network, hosts-data, etc.)

vip_dhcp_allocation.description: Indicate if virtual IP DHCP allocation mode is enabled.

additional_ntp_source.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

api_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API.

api_vips.description: The virtual IPs used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

base_dns_domain.description: Base domain of the cluster. All DNS records must be sub-domains of this base and include the cluster name.

cluster_network_cidr.description: IP address block from which Pod IPs are allocated. This block must not overlap with existing physical networks. These IP addresses are used for the Pod network, and if you need to access the Pods from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_network_host_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length to assign to each individual node. For example, if clusterNetworkHostPrefix is set to 23, then each node is assigned a /23 subnet out of the given cidr (clusterNetworkCIDR), which allows for 510 (2^(32 - 23) - 2) pod IPs addresses. If you are required to provide access to nodes from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_networks.description: Cluster networks that are associated with this cluster.

cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

high_availability_mode.description:
Guaranteed availability of the installed cluster. 'Full' installs a Highly-Available cluster
over multiple master nodes whereas 'None' installs a full cluster over one node.

http_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTP connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

https_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTPS connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

hyperthreading.description: Enable/disable hyperthreading on master nodes, worker nodes, or all nodes.

ingress_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used for cluster ingress traffic.

ingress_vips.description: The virtual IPs used for cluster ingress traffic. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

machine_networks.description: Machine networks that are associated with this cluster.

no_proxy.description: An "*" or a comma-separated list of destination domain names, domains, IP addresses, or other network CIDRs to exclude from proxying.

olm_operators.description: List of OLM operators to be installed.

pull_secret.description: The pull secret obtained from Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager at console.redhat.com/openshift/install/pull-secret.

service_network_cidr.description: The IP address pool to use for service IP addresses. You can enter only one IP address pool. If you need to access the services from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

service_networks.description: Service networks that are associated with this cluster.

ssh_public_key.description: SSH public key for debugging OpenShift nodes.

tags.description: A comma-separated list of tags that are associated to the cluster.

user_managed_networking.description: Indicate if the networking is managed by the user.

vip_dhcp_allocation.description: Indicate if virtual IP DHCP allocation mode is enabled.

host_id.description: Unique identifier of the host the requirements relate to.

operators.description: Host requirements related to requested operators

installation_disk_speed_threshold_ms.description: Required installation disk speed in ms

network_latency_threshold_ms.description: Maximum network average latency (RTT) at L3 for role.

packet_loss_percentage.description: Maximum packet loss allowed at L3 for role.

ram_mib.description: Required number of RAM in MiB

tpm_enabled_in_bios.description: Whether TPM module should be enabled in host's BIOS.

forbidden_hostnames.description: This provides a list of forbidden hostnames. If this list is empty or not present, this implies that the UI should fall back to a hard coded list.

cluster_network.description: A network from which Pod IPs are allocated. This block must not overlap with existing physical networks. These IP addresses are used for the Pod network, and if you need to access the Pods from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this network is associated with.

host_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length to assign to each individual node. For example if is set to 23, then each node is assigned a /23 subnet out of the given CIDR, which allows for 510 (2^(32 - 23) - 2) pod IPs addresses.

download_rate.description: The rate of size/time in seconds MBps.

size_bytes.description: Size of the image in bytes.

time.description: Seconds it took to pull the image.

images.description: List of image names to be checked.

timeout.description: Positive number represents a timeout in seconds for a pull operation.

images.description: List of images that were checked.

file_name.description: The name of the manifest to customize the installed OCP cluster.

folder.description: The folder that contains the files. Manifests can be placed in 'manifests' or 'openshift' directories.

api_vip_lease.description: Contents of lease file to be used for API virtual IP.

api_vip_mac.description: MAC address for the API virtual IP.

ingress_vip_lease.description: Contents of lease file to be used for for Ingress virtual IP.

ingress_vip_mac.description: MAC address for the Ingress virtual IP.

interface.description: The network interface (NIC) to run the DHCP requests on.

api_vip_address.description: The IPv4 address that was allocated by DHCP for the API virtual IP.

api_vip_lease.description: Contents of last acquired lease for API virtual IP.

ingress_vip_address.description: The IPv4 address that was allocated by DHCP for the Ingress virtual IP.

ingress_vip_lease.description: Contents of last acquired lease for Ingress virtual IP.

by_id.description: by-id is the World Wide Number of the device which guaranteed to be unique for every storage device

by_path.description: by-path is the shortest physical path to the device

holders.description: A comma-separated list of disk names that this disk belongs to

id.description: Determine the disk's unique identifier which is the by-id field if it exists and fallback to the by-path field otherwise

eligible.description: Whether the disk is eligible for installation or not.

not_eligible_reasons.description: Reasons for why this disk is not eligible for installation.

is_installation_media.description: Whether the disk appears to be an installation media or not

enable_on.description: Enable/disable disk encryption on master nodes, worker nodes, or all nodes.

mode.description: The disk encryption mode to use.

tang_servers.description: JSON-formatted string containing additional information regarding tang's configuration

disk-skip-formatting-params.description: Allows an addition or removal of a host disk from the host's skip_formatting_disks list

disk_id.description: The ID of the disk that is being added to or removed from the host's skip_formatting_disks list

skip_formatting.description: True if you wish to add the disk to the skip_formatting_disks list, false if you wish to remove it

path.description: --filename argument for fio (expects a file or a block device path).

io_sync_duration.description: The 99th percentile of fdatasync durations in milliseconds.

domain_name.description: The domain name that should be resolved

ipv4_addresses.description: The IPv4 addresses of the domain, empty if none

ipv6_addresses.description: The IPv6 addresses of the domain, empty if none

download_boot_artifacts_request.description: Information sent to the agent for downloading artifacts to boot a host into discovery.

host_fs_mount_dir.description:
The base directory on the host that contains the /boot folder. The host will download boot
artifacts into a folder in this directory.

initrd_url.description: URL address to download the initrd.

kernel_url.description: URL address to download the kernel.

rootfs_url.description: URL address to download the rootfs.

code.description: Globally unique code of the error, composed of the unique identifier of the API and the numeric identifier of the error. For example, if the numeric identifier of the error is 93 and the identifier of the API is assisted_install then the code will be ASSISTED-INSTALL-93.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will always be 'Error'.

cluster_id.description: Unique identifier of the cluster this event relates to.

host_id.description: Unique identifier of the host this event relates to.

infra_env_id.description: Unique identifier of the infra-env this event relates to.

props.description: Additional properties for the event in JSON format.

request_id.description: Unique identifier of the request that caused this event to occur.

feature-support-level.description: (DEPRECATED) List of features attached to openshift version

feature-support-levels.description: (DEPRECATED) List of objects that containing a list of feature-support level and attached to openshift-version

name.description: Product name of the device (for example "UHD Graphics 620 (Whiskey Lake)")

vendor.description: The name of the device vendor (for example "Intel Corporation")

checked_in_at.description: The last time the host's agent communicated with the service.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this host is associated with.

disks_info.description: Additional information about disks, formatted as JSON.

disks_to_be_formatted.description:
A comma-separated list of disks that will be formatted once
installation begins, unless otherwise set to be skipped by
skip_formatting_disks. This means that this list also includes disks
that appear in skip_formatting_disks. This property is managed by the
service and cannot be modified by the user.

ignition_config_overrides.description: Json formatted string containing the user overrides for the host's pointer ignition

ignition_endpoint_token_set.description: True if the token to fetch the ignition from ignition_endpoint_url is set.

infra_env_id.description: The infra-env that this host is associated with.

installation_disk_id.description: Contains the inventory disk id to install on.

installation_disk_path.description: Contains the inventory disk path, This field is replaced by installation_disk_id field and used for backward compatability with the old UI.

kind.description:
Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Host' if this is a complete object or 'HostLink' if it is just a link, or
'AddToExistingClusterHost' for host being added to existing OCP cluster, or

ntp_sources.description: The configured NTP sources on the host.

registered_at.description: The last time the host's agent tried to register in the service.

skip_formatting_disks.description:
A comma-seperated list of host disks that the service will avoid
formatting.

stage_started_at.description: Time at which the current progress stage started.

stage_updated_at.description: Time at which the current progress stage was last updated.

status_updated_at.description: The last time that the host status was updated.

timestamp.description: The time on the host as seconds since the Unix epoch.

validations_info.description: JSON-formatted string containing the validation results for each validation id grouped by category (network, hardware, etc.)

stage_started_at.description: Time at which the current progress stage started.

stage_updated_at.description: Time at which the current progress stage was last updated.

qualitative.description: Host requirements that cannot be quantified at the time of calculation. Descriptions or formulas of requiements

disks_skip_formatting.description: Allows changing the host's skip_formatting_disks parameter

ignition_endpoint_token.description: A string which will be used as Authorization Bearer token to fetch the ignition from ignition_endpoint_url.

node_labels.description: Labels to be added to the corresponding node.

next_step_runner_command.description: Command for starting the next step runner

retry_seconds.description: How long in seconds to wait before retrying registration if the command fails

network_yaml.description: yaml string that can be processed by nmstate

ignition-endpoint.description: Explicit ignition endpoint overrides the default ignition endpoint.

ca_certificate.description: base64 encoded CA certficate to be used when contacting the URL via https.

url.description: The URL for the ignition endpoint.

cluster-validation-ids.description: JSON-formatted list of cluster validation IDs that will be ignored for all hosts that belong to this cluster. It may also contain a list with a single string "all" to ignore all cluster validations. Some validations cannot be ignored.

host-validation-ids.description: JSON-formatted list of host validation IDs that will be ignored for all hosts that belong to this cluster. It may also contain a list with a single string "all" to ignore all host validations. Some validations cannot be ignored.

ssh_public_key.description: SSH public key for debugging the installation.
SSH public key for debugging the installation.

static_network_config.description: static network configuration string in the format expected by discovery ignition generation

api_vip_dnsname.description: The domain name used to reach the OpenShift cluster API.

openshift_cluster_id.description: The id of the OCP cluster, that hosts will be added to

additional_ntp_sources.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

additional_trust_bundle.description:
PEM-encoded X.509 certificate bundle. Hosts discovered by this
infra-env will trust the certificates in this bundle. Clusters formed
from the hosts discovered by this infra-env will also trust the
certificates in this bundle.

cluster_id.description: If set, all hosts that register will be associated with the specified cluster.

cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

ignition_config_override.description: Json formatted string containing the user overrides for the initial ignition config.

kernel_arguments.description: JSON formatted string array representing the discovery image kernel arguments.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object.

openshift_version.description: Version of the OpenShift cluster (used to infer the RHCOS version - temporary until generic logic implemented).

pull_secret_set.description: True if the pull secret has been added to the cluster.

ssh_authorized_key.description: SSH public key for debugging the installation.

static_network_config.description: static network configuration string in the format expected by discovery ignition generation.

updated_at.description: The last time that this infra-env was updated.

additional_ntp_sources.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

additional_trust_bundle.description:
PEM-encoded X.509 certificate bundle. Hosts discovered by this
infra-env will trust the certificates in this bundle. Clusters formed
from the hosts discovered by this infra-env will also trust the
certificates in this bundle.

cluster_id.description: If set, all hosts that register will be associated with the specified cluster.

cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

ignition_config_override.description: JSON formatted string containing the user overrides for the initial ignition config.

openshift_version.description: Version of the OpenShift cluster (used to infer the RHCOS version - temporary until generic logic implemented).

pull_secret.description: The pull secret obtained from Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager at console.redhat.com/openshift/install/pull-secret.

ssh_authorized_key.description: SSH public key for debugging the installation.

additional_ntp_sources.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

additional_trust_bundle.description: Allows users to change the additional_trust_bundle infra-env field

ignition_config_override.description: JSON formatted string containing the user overrides for the initial ignition config.

pull_secret.description: The pull secret obtained from Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager at console.redhat.com/openshift/install/pull-secret.

ssh_authorized_key.description: SSH public key for debugging the installation.

ingress_vip.description: The virtual IP used for cluster ingress traffic.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this VIP is associated with.

boot_device.description: Boot device to write image on

high_availability_mode.description:
Guaranteed availability of the installed cluster. 'Full' installs a Highly-Available cluster
over multiple master nodes whereas 'None' installs a full cluster over one node.

args.description: List of additional arguments passed to coreos-installer

sync_duration.description: 99th percentile of fsync duration in milliseconds

kernel_argument.description: pair of [operation, argument] specifying the argument and what operation should be applied on it.

operation.description: The operation to apply on the kernel argument.

value.description:
Kernel argument can have the form <parameter> or <parameter>=<value>. The following examples should
be supported:
rd.net.timeout.carrier=60
isolcpus=1,2,10-20,100-2000:2/25
quiet
The parsing by the command line parser in linux kernel is much looser and this pattern follows it.

kernel_arguments.description: List of kernel arugment objects that define the operations and values to be applied.

average_rtt_ms.description: Average round trip time in milliseconds.

packet_loss_percentage.description: Percentage of packets lost during connectivity check.

logical_nic_name.description: nic name used in the yaml, which relates 1:1 to the mac address

mac_address.description: mac address present on the host

machine_network.description: A network that all hosts belonging to the cluster should have an interface with IP address in. The VIPs (if exist) belong to this network.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this network is associated with.

file_name.description: The file name prefaced by the folder that contains it.

folder.description: The folder that contains the files. Manifests can be placed in 'manifests' or 'openshift' directories.

cluster_id.description: The cluster that this operator is associated with.

namespace.description: Namespace where to deploy an operator. Only some operators require a namespace.

properties.description: Blob of operator-dependent parameters that are required for installation.

status_info.description: Detailed information about the operator state.

status_updated_at.description: Time at which the operator was last updated.

subscription_name.description: The name of the subscription of the operator.

timeout_seconds.description: Positive number represents a timeout in seconds for the operator to be available.

key.description: The key for the label's key-value pair.

value.description: The value for the label's key-value pair.

ntp_source.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

default.description: Indication that the version is the recommended one.

display_name.description: Name of the version to be presented to the user.

support_level.description: Level of support of the version.

properties.description: Blob of operator-dependent parameters that are required for installation.

dependencies.description: List of other operator unique names that are required to be installed. Corresponds to name property of the monitored-operator, i.e. "lso", "cnv", etc.

operator_name.description: Unique name of the operator. Corresponds to name property of the monitored-operator, i.e. "lso", "cnv", etc.

status_info.description: Detailed information about the operator state.

mandatory.description: Indicates whether the property is reqired

operator-type.description: Kind of operator. Different types are monitored by the service differently.

cpu_architecture.description: The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

openshift_version.description: Version of the operating system image

url.description: The base OS image used for the discovery iso.

version.description: Build ID of the OS image.

platform.description: The configuration for the specific platform upon which to perform the installation.

is_external.description: Indicates if the underlying platform type is external.

expires_at.description: Expiration time for the URL token.

url.description: Pre-signed URL for downloading the infra-env discovery image.

http_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTP connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

https_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTPS connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

no_proxy.description: An "*" or a comma-separated list of destination domain names, domains, IP addresses, or other network CIDRs to exclude from proxying.

reboot_for_reclaim_request.description: Information sent to the agent for rebooting a host into discovery.

host_fs_mount_dir.description:
The base directory on the host that contains the /boot folder. The host needs to
chroot into this directory in order to properly reboot.

cpu_architecture.description: (DEPRECATED) The CPU architecture of the image (x86_64/arm64/etc).

cpu_architectures.description: List of CPU architectures provided by the image.

default.description: Indication that the version is the recommended one.

support_level.description: Level of support of the version.

url.description: The installation image of the OpenShift cluster.

version.description: OCP version from the release metadata.

destination.description: The destination network or destination host

family.description: Defines whether this is an IPv4 (4) or IPv6 route (6)

gateway.description: Gateway address where the packets are sent

interface.description: Interface to which packets for this route will be sent

service_network.description: IP address block for service IP blocks.

cluster_id.description: A network to use for service IP addresses. If you need to access the services from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

post_step_action.description: What to do after finishing to run step instructions

support-levels.description: Map of feature ID or CPU architecture alongside their support level

virtual.description: Whether the machine appears to be a virtual machine or not

tang_servers.description: JSON-formatted string containing additional information regarding tang's configuration

file_name.description: The file name for the manifest to modify.

folder.description: The folder for the manifest to modify.

updated_content.description: The new base64 encoded manifest content.

updated_file_name.description: The new file name for the manifest.

updated_folder.description: The new folder for the manifest. Manifests can be placed in 'manifests' or 'openshift' directories.

agent_image.description:
Full image reference of the image that the agent should upgrade to, for example
`quay.io/registry-proxy.engineering.redhat.com/rh-osbs/openshift4-assisted-installer-agent-rhel8:v1.0.0-142`.

Full image reference of the image that the agent has upgraded to, for example
`quay.io/registry-proxy.engineering.redhat.com/rh-osbs/openshift4-assisted-installer-agent-rhel8:v1.0.0-142`.

name.description: name of the feature to track

additional_ntp_source.description: A comma-separated list of NTP sources (name or IP) going to be added to all the hosts.

api_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API.

api_vip_dns_name.description: The domain name used to reach the OpenShift cluster API.

api_vips.description: The virtual IPs used to reach the OpenShift cluster's API. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

base_dns_domain.description: Base domain of the cluster. All DNS records must be sub-domains of this base and include the cluster name.

cluster_network_cidr.description: IP address block from which Pod IPs are allocated. This block must not overlap with existing physical networks. These IP addresses are used for the Pod network, and if you need to access the Pods from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_network_host_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length to assign to each individual node. For example, if clusterNetworkHostPrefix is set to 23, then each node is assigned a /23 subnet out of the given cidr (clusterNetworkCIDR), which allows for 510 (2^(32 - 23) - 2) pod IPs addresses. If you are required to provide access to nodes from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

cluster_networks.description: Cluster networks that are associated with this cluster.

http_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTP connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

https_proxy.description:
A proxy URL to use for creating HTTPS connections outside the cluster.
http://\<username\>:\<pswd\>@\<ip\>:\<port\>

hyperthreading.description: Enable/disable hyperthreading on master nodes, worker nodes, or all nodes.

ingress_vip.description: (DEPRECATED) The virtual IP used for cluster ingress traffic.

ingress_vips.description: The virtual IPs used for cluster ingress traffic. Enter one IP address for single-stack clusters, or up to two for dual-stack clusters (at most one IP address per IP stack used). The order of stacks should be the same as order of subnets in Cluster Networks, Service Networks, and Machine Networks.

machine_network_cidr.description: A CIDR that all hosts belonging to the cluster should have an interfaces with IP address that belongs to this CIDR. The api_vip belongs to this CIDR.

machine_networks.description: Machine networks that are associated with this cluster.

no_proxy.description: An "*" or a comma-separated list of destination domain names, domains, IP addresses, or other network CIDRs to exclude from proxying.

olm_operators.description: List of OLM operators to be installed.

pull_secret.description: The pull secret obtained from Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager at console.redhat.com/openshift/install/pull-secret.

service_network_cidr.description: The IP address pool to use for service IP addresses. You can enter only one IP address pool. If you need to access the services from an external network, configure load balancers and routers to manage the traffic.

service_networks.description: Service networks that are associated with this cluster.

ssh_public_key.description: SSH public key for debugging OpenShift nodes.

tags.description: A comma-separated list of tags that are associated to the cluster.

user_managed_networking.description: Indicate if the networking is managed by the user.

vip_dhcp_allocation.description: Indicate if virtual IP DHCP allocation mode is enabled.

verify_vips_request.description: list of vips to be verified.

version.description: Version of the component for which requirements are defined
